name: Sweet Potato Dumplings with Canned Biscuits
author: Brian Bolling
summary: This super simple sweet potato dumpling recipe is always a huge hit.
ingredients: 1 (10 ounce) can refrigerated biscuit dough (such as Pillsbury Grands!®)
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Place butter in a 9x13-inch baking dish; melt in the preheating oven
Peel and cut sweet potato into 1/2-inch thick slices and cut in half again to make half-moon pieces
Pull each biscuit apart to make two
Wrap each biscuit around a piece of sweet potato
Arrange dumplings in the prepared baking dish
Bring water, sugar, and pumpkin pie spice to a boil in a pan; stir until sugar is dissolved
Bake in the preheated oven until biscuits are browned and sweet potato is tender, 35 to 40 minutes
Baste top of biscuits with the sauce every 10 minutes or so to keep them from burning
